content.description: I heard you wanted a warm-up for your warm-up. You're Welcome!
content.location: Follows the corner and crack system on the right hand side of the wall. Just right of "Always Welcome"

climbs.name: Super Smash Bros
climbs.fa: Sam Roehrich, Kemper Brightman, Luke Bertelsen

content.description:
The start looks like an offwidth, but a jug flake to the right saves the day. Follow the primary weakness of the wall over several ledges before being deposited below a perma-draw and  the crux of the route. Here, a powerful compression sequence between positive jugs and flakes leads to the chert field above.

 Some of the ledges on this route are still a bit dusty, but the vast majority of choss has been removed thanks to a couple smashing young developers.
content.location: This is the second route from the right on Welcome Wall proper. The route can be identified by the perma-draw mid route and offwidth sized crack at the base.

content.description:
Pocket Knife climbs a fun line of pocket and pod features up the slightly overhung wall just left of a major corner feature.  Long moves and good holds are abundant on this route with a nice little puzzle thrown in for good measure just before the chains.  If you choose to stem right at the last bolt you're only robbing yourself.

 This climb is destined for 3-star status once in has cleaned up a bit more with traffic.
content.location: Currently the leftmost route on the Welcome Wall located slightly uphill from the main belay area.

climbs.name: No Purchase Necessary
climbs.fa: Matt Martinez, Luke Bertelsen, Jon Mavko, Anais Quintela Oct 2019

content.description:
The Farmhouse approach may leave you feeling broke(n) but don’t worry, it’s a small price to pay...

This route is a diamond in the rough. While a little visually bankrupt, the movement is money. A few bolts of mellow climbing, pulling long moves on slopers over several shelves puts you at the base of a low budget boulder problem bulge that deposits you on a large ledge with a highly equitable no hands rest. The crux revolves around setting up on dime edge feet and fingers for a dead point to a devious slimper that may feel impossible to gain purchase of. But don't put your wallet away, a couple more bolts of strenuous moves gives way to 30-40’ of chert pulling that will challenge your endurance. As the angle turns up, the holds get bigger and pulling the roof will make you feel like you won the chert lottery. Clip the chains and enjoy the jackpot - a stellar view and sense of accomplishment. 

And you didn’t have to spend a single dollar.

This is a fun route that has a little bit of everything: a choose-your-own-adventure boulder start, sustained climbing over two ledges, and a technical and cryptic crux sequence on key holds through the final headwall. The final easy push to the chains is guarded by a high redpoint crux.
content.location: Just to the right of Super Smash Bros on the main face, prior to turning the corner towards Always Welcome, Never Invited.

content.description:
Low and behold, here is an honest to goodness moderate romp up the Welcome Wall.  The trail to the left side of the Farmhouse areas nearly deposits you directly at the base of this climb.

 Stem your way up plentiful pods and pockets before the climb gives way to alternating layback cracks and flakes. There are wonderful clipping stances and good holds galore all the way to the chains.

 This one is sure to be popular. especially as it continues to clean up.
content.location: Just left of Always Welcome, Never Invited.  Pre-clip the first bolt from the ledge and start your climbing down below for some added fun.

content.description:
With mostly 5.8/5.9 climbing and two short little cruxes sprinkled in, this one is the perfect pitch to get you ready for any of the harder lines at Welcome Wall or The Coop.  There is interesting and enjoyable climbing from top to bottom including chert pulling and lay backing sequences that will have most climbers asking for a second lap.

 Get in line.  This one is an immediate area classic.
content.location: Currently the furthest right route at Welcome Wall just around the corner from most of the routes and slightly uphill.

climbs.name: Always Blunt, Never Dull
climbs.fa: Luke Bertelsen, Jon Mavko, Kemper Brightman - Nov. 2018

content.description:
Always Blunt, Never Dull climbs an amazing rounded and slightly overhung arete with involved and improbable sequences the entire way.  There is nary a crimp to be found on the entire route, but you will find a wide array of compression moves, toe hooks, heel hooks, and some kneebars thrown in just for good measure.

 From low on the route the difficulty builds nicely, culminating in a hug and slap-a-thon just above mid-height.  If you can climb through the crux you will still have to navigate a few more bolts of 5.11 before larger chert holds begin to appear and you can cruise up to the chains.

 This climb is awesome and YOU should do it!
content.location: First route right of Pocket Knife just across the wide blocky corner.

content.description: This is the western most sector of The Prow with really nice vertical and slightly overhung walls featured with lots of chert.This area was the product of a grand 2018 experiment known as 'Bolt Camp'.  Area developers hung ropes and pre-cleaned lines area of time so several folks could bolt routes over the course of two days.  Thank a developer.
